titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the John C. Wilson Papers
titlestmt.author: Beinecke staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday April 23, 2019 at 03:47

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The John C. Wilson papers consist of scrapbooks, photographs, and other material documenting the life and work of American producer and director John C. Wilson.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: Acquired by gift and purchase, 2015-2016. For more information consult the appropriate curator.

accessrestrict.head: Information About Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.
Box 60-61 (scrapbooks): Restricted fragile material. For further information consult the appropriate curator.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The John C. Wilson papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Cite As
prefercite.p: John C. Wilson Papers. Yale Collection of American Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

bioghist.head: John C. Wilson (1899-1961)
bioghist.p: Born in Trenton, New Jersey and educated at Phillips Academy and Yale University, John C. Wilson (1899-1961) worked briefly for C. D. Barney & Co. on Wall Street before becoming a producer and director. From the early 1930s to mid 1950s, Wilson served as Noel Coward's personal manager and, in 1934, with Coward, Lynn Fontanne, and Alfred Lunt, he established Transatlantic Productions, with exclusive production rights to Coward's plays in the United States. Wilson also served as co-director of the Westport Country Playhouse from the early 1940s to mid 1950s.

scopecontent.head: Description of the Papers
scopecontent.p: In Series I, sixty-one scrapbooks containing clippings, printed ephemera, and photographs document Wilson's life, activities, and interests. Clippings relate to Wilson's stage productions, stage and film actors, theater, and other topics. Photographic materials in Series II include photograph albums, studio and artists' portraits of Wilson, snapshots of Wilson and others, and publicity photographs of stage productions. There are photographs of Wilson, family members, friends, and stage colleagues, including: Wilson's wife, Natalie Paley, Leonora Corbett, Noel Coward, Martin Manulis, Armina Marshall, Mildred Natwick, Graham Payn, and Clifton Webb, among others. Other papers include correspondence, printed material, such as playbills, writings, and other material.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into three series: Series I. Scrapbooks, 1919-1961. II. Photographs, 1900-1969. III. Other Papers, 1898-1978.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Additional material by or relating to Wilson can be found in the John C. Wilson Theater Collection on Noel Coward (GEN MSS 608).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series I. consists of 61 scrapbooks containing material relating to Wilson's life, activities, and interests. Scrapbooks contain clippings chiefly, dating from 1919 through 1961, but printed ephemera and photographs can also be found. Clippings relate to Wilson's stage productions, stage and film actors, and other topics.
Clippings chiefly in English, with some material in French.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Box 60: Restricted fragile material. For further information consult the appropriate curator.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Box 61: Restricted fragile material. For further information consult the appropriate curator.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into three subseries: Photograph Albums, Studio and Artists' Portraits, and Other Photographs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series II. Photographs contains photogaph albums, studio and artists' portraits of Wilson, snapshots of Wilson and others, and approximately 50 publicity photographs of stage productions of Wilson's "Broadway Shows." Albums document Wilson's childhood and trips to Europe in the 1920s and 1930s. Snapshots include Wilson's family, friends, and stage colleagues: Wilson's wife, Natalie Paley, Leonora Corbett, Noel Coward, Martin Manulis, Armina Marshall, Mildred Natwick, Graham Payn, and Clifton Webb, among others. The publicity photographs identify actors and productions.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into four subseries: Correspondence, Printed Material, Writings, and Other Material.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series III. Other Papers includes correspondence, printed material, writings, and other material. Correspondents includes Noel Coward and Wilson's niece, Barbara (Cart) Macauley, and sister, Dorothy Wilson. The printed materials feature approximately 100 playbills for stage productions relating to Wilson and Coward. Writings include drafts of biographical and autobiographical works, "Actors Aren't People" and "Stagestruck" respectively. Other personal and juvenile items, such as a baby book, coloring book, and locks of Wilson's hair, can also be found.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into two subdivisions: John C. Wilson Correspondence and Third Party Correspondence.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into three subdivisions: Periodicals, Playbills, and Other Ephemera.
